net.antidot.api.search

Class PagerHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.antidot.api.search.PagerHelper

  • public class PagerHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper to access pager information for a given reply set.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PagerHelper(Pager pagerPb, QueryCoder queryCoder, Query query)
      Constructs reply set pager helper.

    • Method Summary

      Retrieves current page number.

      Retrieves link to appropriate result page.

      Retrieves next page number.

      Retrieves all pages as a list.

      Retrieves previous page number.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PagerHelper

        public PagerHelper(Pager pagerPb,
           QueryCoder queryCoder,
           Query query)
        Constructs reply set pager helper. You should never need to create such object directly. This is managed by parent helper (see ReplySetHelper).
        Parameters:
        pagerPb - [in] Google protobuf.
        queryCoder - [in] coder used to generate links.
        query - [in] query corresponding to current result page. It is also used to generate links.

    • Method Detail

      • hasPrevious

        public boolean hasPrevious()
        Checks whether previous page exists.
        Returns:
        true when previous page exists, false otherwise.

      • getPrevious

        public long getPrevious()
        Retrieves previous page number.
        Returns:
        previous page number.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - when previous page is not defined.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Checks whether next page exists.
        Returns:
        true when next page exists, false otherwise.

      • getNext

        public long getNext()
        Retrieves next page number.
        Returns:
        next page number.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - when next page is not defined.

      • getPages

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> getPages()

        Returns:
        list of pages.

      • getLink

        public java.lang.String getLink(java.lang.Long pageNo)
                         throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Retrieves link to appropriate result page.
        Parameters:
        pageNo - [in] page to switch on.
        Returns:
        valid link for query with specified page number.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - cannot generate link (should not happen).
